business.headline: Madhya Pradesh: Rs 1,553 crore for Ladli Behna Yojana released. Check eligibilityLadli Behna Yojana aims to improve women's well-being, health, nutrition and economic independence. Presently, Rs 1,250 per month is given to all the eligible women under this scheme.

8th Pay Commission: Will its implementation face delays?Despite several measures announced for taxpayers in the Union Budget 2025, there was no mention of the financial impact of implementing the 8th Pay Commission.

Are you eligible for fixed medical allowance under NPS? Check details Retired central government civilian employees who are covered under the National Pension System will now be eligible for fixed medical allowance, announced the Department of Pension & Pensioners' Welfare.

Sensex ends 1,000 points lower: 5 factors behind today's stock market crashInvestors lost nearly Rs 10 lakh crore as selling pressure intensified across sectors due to various factors that dampened investor sentiment.

Sensex falls 1,000 points, investors lose Rs 10 lakh crore on Dalal StreetThe S&P BSE Sensex tanked by 1,1018.20 points to end at 76,293.60, while the NSE Nifty50 fell by 309.80 points to close at 23,071.80.

India's inflation likely to dip to a 5-month low of 4.60% in January: ReportThe country's consumer inflation is expected to fall to a five-month low of 4.60% in January 2025, as compared to 5.22% which was recorded in December last year, as per Reuters.

India to keep ban on Chinese investments for now, says Chief Economic AdviserSpeaking at an event in Mumbai on Tuesday, Chief Economic Adviser (CEA) V. Anantha Nageswaran said that any changes to the current restrictions would take time and require a deeper understanding between both countries.

Coimbatore company rewards employees with Rs 14.5 crore bonus. Here's whyA few days ago, the CEO, Saravana Kumar, formally announced the release of the bonus. He shared that he deliberately did not choose to offer employee stock options (ESOPS) or performance-based incentives.

Hotmail co-founder Sabeer Bhatia critisises Aadhaar and UPI in a podcast Sabeer Bhatia mentioned that the use of video and voiceprint technology for the Aadhaar project, which is already embedded in smartphones, could have been a better approach which could have achieved the same results at much lower costs.

Not Mumbai or Bengaluru, this Indian city leads in luxury home price surgeMumbai, traditionally known for its expensive real estate, was placed seventh in the global rankings for luxury home price surge.

Sensex crashes over 1,000 points: What's behind today's stock market bloodbath?Stock market crash: At 1:12 pm, the Sensex was down 1051.88 points to 76,261.90, and the Nifty fell 321.15 points to 23,060.45. Most broader market indices were also in the red as volatility spiked sharply.

New Income Tax Bill expected soon: Here's what taxpayers can expect The new bill aims to make direct tax laws simpler, reduce litigation, and remove ambiguities in the current system. Experts believe it will be easier to understand, more user-friendly, and free of unnecessary complexities.

Sacked Infosys trainees share ordeal after mass termination: 'This is inhumane'The sacked trainee employees, who were onboarded after 2.5 years of wait, were called in batches of 50 starting from 9.30 am on February 7. They were escorted to a room guarded by security and bouncers where they were made to sign a mutual separation letter.

PM Modi inaugurates India Energy Week 2025, outlines green energy targetsPrime Minister Narendra Modi virtually launched India Energy Week 2025, reaffirming India's commitment to green energy. He announced plans to add 500 GW of renewable capacity and outlined ambitious 2030 sustainability goals, citing India's strong track record over the past decade.

Explained: Why Zomato share price plunged over 5% todayZomato stock price: Shares of the company have been under pressure ever since global brokerage firm Jefferies raised concerns over rising competition in the quick commerce space.

India 1st G20 country to achieve Paris Agreement goals, says PM Narendra ModiPrime Minister Narendra Modi also outlined various other green energy targets to achieve by the year 2030, calling them ambitious yet possible given the excellent track record in the past 10 years.

Why Eicher Motors shares dropped 7% despite record Royal Enfield sales in Q3Eicher Motors stock price fell nearly 7% in early trade despite reporting a 18% year-on-year rise in consolidated net profit.

Nokia picks Intel's AI and data centre leader Justin Hotard as new CEOJustin Hotard, who will take up the position on April 1, is currently the executive vice president and general manager of Data Center & AI Group at Intel, according to the chipmaker's website.
Stock market sell-off hurting your portfolio? Here's what you can doThe ongoing stock market sell-off has hit retail investors hard, dragging portfolios deep into the red.

Sensex falls nearly 200 points, Nifty struggles in early tradeStock Market Today: The S&P BSE Sensex was down 197.45 points to 77,114.35 at 9:29 am, while the NSE Nifty50 fell 62.90 points to trade at 23,318.70. All the other broader market indices were also trading in negative territory.

entertainment.headline: Munawar Faruqui to Vir Das, comedians who landed in trouble for inappropriate jokesAs podcaster Ranveer Allahbadia faces backlash for his obscene jokes on an episode of India's Got Latent, here's a look at other stand-up comedians who have found themselves in trouble.

Diddy allegedly 'drugged and raped' a man, claims new lawsuitMusic mogul Sean Combs is embroiled in fresh legal trouble as an anonymous plaintiff files a sexual assault lawsuit against him in New York.

The phone dropped...: Story of Jitendra Kumar's humility and unassuming successActor Jitendra Kumar, popularly known as Jeetu Bhaiya, says the bigger thing is not to decide whether to take a risk in life or not, but to know what is at stake.

Arunachal women panel condemns Elvish Yadav's 'racist' remarks against Chum DarangThe Arunachal Pradesh State Commission for Women has condemned Elvish Yadav's derogatory remarks against Chum Darang and has demanded strict action. The comments have sparked backlash.

Kadhalikka Neramillai: Nithya Menen, Ravi Mohan's rom-com now streaming on NetflixKadhalikka Neramillai, the heartfelt romantic film, starring Nithya Menen and Ravi Mohan is streaming on OTT. The Tamil film had its theatrical release on January 14.

Suzhal The Vortex Season 2 to premiere on Prime Video this monthA brand-new season of the Tamil Prime Video series, Suzhal: The Vortex, was announced on Tuesday. The show will begin streaming on the OTT platform from this month itself.

Squid Game 3 to have 6 episodes. Fans say 'they better be 2 hours long'Fans of Squid Game are eagerly awaiting the third season. However, the revelation of the season having only six episodes has left many fans disappointed.

Solo Leveling Season 2: Animation peaks as Jinwoo defeats dungeon bossThe latest episode of Solo Leveling peaked with its brilliantly animated fight sequence. In the episode, titled Don't Look Down on My Guys, Sung Jinwoo clashed with Karlgargan.

Uorfi Javed defends friend Samay Raina amid calls for his arrestUorfi Javed slammed people demanding jail time for YouTuber Ranveer Allahbadia and comedian Samay Raina after Allahbadia's obscene joke on India's Got Latent went viral.

Samay Raina in Seattle as India's Got Latent and Ranveer Allahbadia face backlashIndian stand-up comedian Samay Raina recently performed in Seattle, as controversies surrounding Ranveer Allahbadia and India's Got Latent stirred social media discussions in India.

Rakhi Sawant asks forgiveness for Ranveer AllahbadiaActor Rakhi Sawant shared a message for fans amid the Ranveer Allahbadia controversy. She requested all to 'forgive' the YouTuber for his recent crass jokes on Samay Raina's show.

Why Sanya Malhotra's Mrs should come with a trigger warningMrs, starring Sanya Malhotra, explores patriarchal society and the struggles of women in arranged marriages. Here's why this movie should come with a trigger warning and must be on your watchlist.

Singer Charlie Puth to Kanye West for selling Swastika T-shirts: I beg you to stopSinger Charlie Puth 'begged' Kanye West to stop after he sold Swastika T-shirts on his website. Kanye's move sparked concern about his 'incredibly dangerous' claims.

Ankita Lokhande tears down Rozlyn Khan's claims about Hina Khan's cancer: So cheapAnkita Lokhande slammed Rozlyn Khan for her claims about Hina Khan's cancer battle. She called out Rozlyn Khan's claims 'cheap'.

Bryan Adams's Australia concert cancelled due to overflowing sewageSinger Bryan Adams's Australia concert was cancelled due to an overflowing sewage issue caused by a "large blockage" of fat, grease, and rags. Adams apologised to fans and assured them that tickets would be refunded.

Arijit Singh takes Ed Sheeran on scooter ride in his hometown in West Bengal. WatchSinger Arijit Singh took pop singer Ed Sheeran on a scooter ride in West Bengal's Jiaganj. The English singer-songwriter ditched heavy security and enjoyed his ride through the streets of West Bengal.

Comedian Kapil Sharma meets Madhya Pradesh Chief Minister Mohan YadavKapil Sharma met Madhya Pradesh Chief Minister Mohan Yadav in Bhopal and shared glimpses of their meeting on social media. He also expressed his gratitude.

BB 18's Chum Darang shares cryptic post after Elvish Yadav's racist remarksChum Darang shared a cryptic post on Instagram, advocating for respect and equality. This came after Elvish Yadav made racist remarks about her.

Decoding Grammy winner Kendrick Lamar's Superbowl half-time performanceKendrick Lamar became the first rapper to headline the Super Bowl solo, marking a major milestone in his career. The performance, featuring SZA and a memorable moment with Serena Williams, somewhat sparked debate on social media.

Jeetendra Kumar aka Jeetu Bhaiya on love, Panchayat, Gen-Z, Kota Factory and IITActor Jeetendra Kumar, popularly known by his screen name, Jeetu Bhaiya from Kota Factory, spoke in an exclusive interview with India Today Digital, about the time when he, for the first time, tasted success. He also discussed his famous roles - Sachiv ji and Jeetu Bhaiya, and mentioned his idea of love and whether he agrees with the Gen-Z and 'situation-ships'.

general news.headline: 2 soldiers killed, 1 critical in Jammu after terrorists trigger IED blastAt least two soldiers were killed and one injured after a suspected improvised explosive device (IED) went off in the Akhnoor sector in Jammu and Kashmir on Tuesday, said the Indian Army.

Maharashtra Police's FIR against Ranveer Allahbadia, others over obscene remarksThe Maharashtra Police has filed a case against 30 people, including Ranveer Allahbadia, Apoorva Mukhija, Samay Raina, Rakhi Sawant, Ashish Chanchlani and, Balraj Ghai.

Nitish Kumar physically tired, mentally retired: Prashant Kishor on Bihar pollsIn an interview with India Today TV, Prashant Kishor said that the NDA coalition in Bihar was presently "at the mercy of BJP" and Nitish Kumar has only remained as a "mask".

Just not confident of HAL: IAF chief's strong words for Tejas-maker over delaysA video from the ongoing Aero India show, in which Air Chief Marshal AP Singh is seen expressing disappointment with the delays in the deliveries of the Tejas Mk1A fighter jets, has gone viral. "At the moment, I am just not confident of Hal," he is heard telling officials of the Hindustan Aeronautics Ltd.

6 experts reveal 7 ways sugar harms your body, plus the worst time to consume itExperts say that sugar is nothing but empty calories that have no benefit on your health and instead, it can be 'deadly as a drug'.

Normalising Indian hate: How Indian-Americans are fighting back in USIndian-Americans are fighting back against racial bullying and the move by Elon Musk to rehire Marko Elez in DOGE. One of their prime targets is US Vice President JD Vance, who is married to Usha Chilkuri, a woman of Telugu descent, but supported Elez's rehiring. Elez, an engineer, had called for "normalising Indian hate".

AI writing code for humanity, global efforts needed to mitigate risks: PM Modi Live UpdatesPrime Minister Narendra Modi, addressing the AI Summit in Paris, highlighted AI's transformative potential in reshaping society, economy, and security, while calling for collective global efforts to establish transparent and inclusive technological governance.
Video: DRDO tests drogue parachutes for Isro's Gaganyaan MissionThe drogue parachutes are designed to stabilise the crew module and reduce its velocity to a safe level during re-entry.

Defending the right to be stupid amid Ranveer Allahbadia stormAs most Indians were busy outraging over Ranveer Allahbadia's remarks on Samay Raina's YouTube show, humorists reminded us why free speech matters. Defending the right to be stupid isn't endorsing stupidity, it is protecting the right to free speech and expression.

Top court seeks poll body's response on EVM verification plea: 'Don't erase data'The Association for Democratic Reforms has filed a plea seeking directions to Election Commission to check and verify EVM's burnt memory and symbol loading unit.
Prince William, Kate Middleton to skip BAFTA. Here's whyPrince William and Kate Middleton will miss the 2025 BAFTAs. The Prince of Wales will make a pre-recorded appearance during the ceremony.

Amidst ignominy of US deportation, a new era of Indian wanderlustThe sobering reality of 104 illegal immigrants being sent back doesn't take away from the fact that Indians did the highest-ever legitimate overseas travel last year

Even after 57 years, Deendayal Upadhyaya's death remains a mysteryFifty-seven years after Pandit Deendayal Upadhyaya's mysterious death, the circumstances remain unclear. On his death anniversary, we remember his major contributions enduring contributions to Indian political thought continue to influence the nation's discourse.

Diljit praised UP administration for his show in Lucknow, not Maha Kumbh prepIn the complete 35-minute video, Diljit answered many questions but did not speak about the ongoing Mahakumbh Mela in Prayagraj.

Deepfakes in hiring and online learning: Can AI fool recruiters and teachers?Deepfakes are blurring reality, and have the potential to pose major risks in online education and hiring. As AI evolves, so must our awareness. This Safer Internet Day, let's know more and prioritise digital literacy and ethical AI use.

JEE Main 2025 Session 1 results out. Check direct link to scorecardThe NTA has released JEE Main 2025 Session 1 results. A total of 14 candidates secured 100 percentile marks. Check your result now on the official website using the direct link.

Did better maternity leave disadvantage Indian women in jobs? Study says…New research indicates after the 26-week paid maternity leave was mandated in 2017, women were 22 per cent less likely to get interview calls from smaller firms in India

Money looted from Punjab now coming to Delhi? Swati Maliwal slams Arvind KejriwalSwati Maliwal also questioned Arvind Kejriwal calling an urgent meeting of AAP legislators in Punjab, just days after the Delhi drubbing.

Why farmers have choked central London with tanks, tractorsHundreds of farmers along with their tractors flocked to Central London to protest against the proposed 20% tax on farm inheritances. Not just tractors, a tank was also seen rolling in London's Parliament Street. The protest in London involving tractors comes months after similar protests were seen in half-a-dozen countries in Europe.

How and where Indian Metro is adding 1,000km to become world No. 2While viral fights and dance videos on our Metro trains steal the spotlight, India's metro is silently rewriting the record books. India has 1,000 km of metro network across 17 cities, and is adding another 1,000 km to it. This is where and how the country is adding metro lines to overtake the US as the world's second-biggest Metro network.

Why Sanya Malhotra's Mrs should come with a trigger warningMrs, starring Sanya Malhotra, explores patriarchal society and the struggles of women in arranged marriages. Here's why this movie should come with a trigger warning and must be on your watchlist.

Indian-origin woman takes a flight to work daily in Malaysia, says it's cost-efficientAn Indian-origin woman, living in Malaysia, has revealed that she takes a flight to work 5 days a week, travels over 700 kilometres a day, and it is still cost-efficient for her. Read on to know more.

Over 10% inflation seen during UPA regime not the case now: Nirmala SitharamanParliament Budget Session: From the weakening rupee to inflation, the Union Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman addressed the Lok Sabha on a range of questions which were posed by both lawmakers from the NDA alliance and the opposition during the discussion on Union Budget 2024-25 in the Lower House on Tuesday. 

Earlier in the day, the Rajya Sabha witnessed an uproar after a BJP MP claimed that copies of the Constitution were missing 22 illustrations that were present in the original copies. The Opposition countered the claim, alleging that it was an attempt to disrespect BR Ambedkar.

The first sitting of the Budget Session, which began on January 31, is expected to conclude on February 13.

Appreciate his point: JD Vance lauds PM's remark on fears of AI replacing humansLauding PM Modi's speech at the Paris AI Action Summit, US Vice President JD Vance underscored that AI would never replace human beings.

Chennai street, where SPB lived, officially renamed as SP Balasubrahmanyam RoadKamdar Nagar Main Road in Chennai's Nungambakkam has now officially been named SP Balasubrahmanyam Road. Deputy Chief Minister of Tamil Nadu, Udhaynidhi Stalin unveiled the title board today.

Imtiaz Ali, Manoj Bajpayee on Ranveer Allahbadia row: People are immatureDirector Imtiaz Ali and actor Manoj Bajpayee has reacted to the controversy surrounding YouTuber Ranveer Allahbadia's comment during India's Got Latent.

Old clip of Aamir Khan on offensive comedy resurfaces amid Ranveer Allahbadia rowAamir Khan's old video discussing the responsibility of freedom of speech resurfaces amid controversy over Ranveer Allahbadia's statement on India's Got Latent, drawing public attention to Khan's views on comedy and expression.

Actor Karthi visits Tirupati temple with family. WatchMeiyazhagan actor Karthi recently visited Tirupati temple in Andhra Pradesh with his family. The actor, who usually maintains a low profile regarding his personal life, made a rare appearance with his son Kandhan.

sports.headline: Kapil Dev backs Mohammed Shami to be at his menacing best in Champions TrophyLegendary India all rounder Kapil Dev has backed Mohammed Shami to be at his usual best in the upcoming ICC Champions Trophy 2025. He also shared his views on the possibility of Jasprit Bumrah missing the tournament.

Pakistan vs South Africa Live Streaming: When and where to watch? Pakistan and South Africa will lock horns in the last and final league match of the ongoing tri-series on Wednesday, February 12 at the National Stadium in Karachi. Both teams lost to New Zealand earlier in the series.

There is cricket left in me: Ajinkya Rahane after heroic hundred in Ranji TrophyMumbai captain Ajinkya Rahane scored a stunning second innings hundred in the Ranji Trophy quarter-final. After securing the win against Haryana, Rahane roared that there was still some cricket left in him.

Sunil Gavaskar makes big Champions Trophy prediction for Virat Kohli and team IndiaLegendary India cricketer Sunil Gavaskar has made a big prediction for star India batter Virat Kohli and team India for the upcoming ICC Champions Trophy 2025.

Ex-coach reveals Champions Trophy 2017 blunder from Virat Kohli and Anil KumbleFormer India batting coach Sanjay Bangar has revealed the major blunder committed by Virat Kohli and Anil Kumble-led team management during the ICC Champions Trophy 2017.

Losing 0-3 to India is fine? Ben Duckett clarifies comments after backlashEngland batter Ben Duckett has offered clarification after stating that the team did not care about losing to India 0-3 as long as they won the Champions Trophy. Duckett clarified his statement on X.

Virat Kohli is still the king: Gayle backs batter to do well in Champions TrophyLegendary West Indies batter Chris Gayle has backed Virat Kohli to do well in the Champions Trophy. Gayle has said if Kohli is able to do well in the ICC tournament, it will prolong his ODI career.

Champions Trophy 2025: England, Bazball look for spark in bid to win 1st titleThe Bazballing England will have their work cut out during the Champions Trophy 2025 as they look to bounce back from poor performances in the ODI World Cup and T20 World Cup in 2023 and 2024 respectively. Buttler and co. will be tasked with a few problems during their campaign in Pakistan.

Rishabh Pant's adorable interaction with young fan: Fast bowling daalte ho?India wicketkeeper batter Rishabh Pant was seen having an adorable chat with a fan as he signed his T-shirt along with Rohit Sharma and Yashasvi Jaiswal.

Shardul, Rahane star as Mumbai outclass Haryana to seal semi-final berthRanji Trophy 2024-25: Mumbai defeated Haryana by 152 runs in the quarterfinal to keep their title defence alive. Captain Ajinkya Rahane's second-innings hundred and Shardul Thakur's all-round show were the highlights of Mumbai's dominant win in Kolkata.

Bangladesh cricketer handed 5-year ban after fixing chargesBangladesh women's cricketer Shohely Akhter has been banned for five years after charges of fixing against her during the 2023 Women's T20 World Cup on South African soil.

Virat Kohli is still the king: Gayle backs batter to do well in Champions TrophyLegendary West Indies batter Chris Gayle has backed Virat Kohli to do well in the Champions Trophy. Gayle has said if Kohli is able to do well in the ICC tournament, it will prolong his ODI career.

Champions Trophy 2025: England, Bazball look for spark in bid to win 1st titleThe Bazballing England will have their work cut out during the Champions Trophy 2025 as they look to bounce back from poor performances in the ODI World Cup and T20 World Cup in 2023 and 2024 respectively. Buttler and co. will be tasked with a few problems during their campaign in Pakistan.

Rishabh Pant's adorable interaction with young fan: Fast bowling daalte ho?India wicketkeeper batter Rishabh Pant was seen having an adorable chat with a fan as he signed his T-shirt along with Rohit Sharma and Yashasvi Jaiswal.

Shardul, Rahane star as Mumbai outclass Haryana to seal semi-final berthRanji Trophy 2024-25: Mumbai defeated Haryana by 152 runs in the quarterfinal to keep their title defence alive. Captain Ajinkya Rahane's second-innings hundred and Shardul Thakur's all-round show were the highlights of Mumbai's dominant win in Kolkata.

Bangladesh cricketer handed 5-year ban after fixing chargesBangladesh women's cricketer Shohely Akhter has been banned for five years after charges of fixing against her during the 2023 Women's T20 World Cup on South African soil.

Salman Butt defends Gaddafi Stadium's lights after Rachin Ravindra's injuryFormer Pakistan cricketer Salman Butt has defended the lighting facilities at the Gaddafi Stadium in Lahore following Rachin Ravindra's gruesome injury in the opening match of the Tri-series against Pakistan.

Rohit is new king in town: Chris Gayle happy to pass baton to India captainLegendary cricketer Chris Gayle praised Rohit Sharma for entertaining fans with his big-hitting approach in one-dayers. The West Indies great also backed Virat Kohli to regain form and shine in the Champions Trophy.

Who is Ahilya Chandel? Japan fast bowler joins DC for WPL 2025WPL 2025: Japan's fast bowler Ahilya Chandel is currently a net bowler for the Delhi Capitals in the Women's Premier League. The left-arm seamer has 30 wickets and a double hat-trick to her name in WT20Is.

Zaheer Khan warns Gautam Gambhir: Creating insecurity will hurt youFormer India fast bowler Zaheer Khan has warned Gautam Gambhir against creating insecurity in the Indian cricket team. Speaking ahead of the Champions Trophy, Zaheer said that Gambhir needs to have a strong communication base with his players.

Watch: Virat Kohli spots close relative amongst fans at airport, gives warm hugStar India batter Virat Kohli spotted a close relative at the airport while travelling for the third ODI against England. The India star immediately walked over and gave a warm hug to the person.

Saurashtra batter Sheldon Jackson retires from professional cricket  Sheldon Jackson retired from professional cricket after Saurashtra lost to Gujarat in the Ranji Trophy in the quarterfinal. Jackson scored 7283 runs from 106 matches in first-class cricket since making his debut in 2011.

Don't care about 0-3 India series loss, want to win Champions Trophy: DuckettEngland opener Ben Duckett does not care about a 0-3 whitewash against India as long as England beats Rohit Sharma's side in the Champions Trophy Final. England are currently trailing India 0-2 in the 3-match series.

Former India bowler names Bumrah's perfect replacement for Champions TrophyWith questions surrounding Jasprit Bumrah's fitness, former India bowler Atul Wassan has named his ideal replacement for the ace speedster in the Champions Trophy 2025 squad.

Watch: Virat Kohli spots close relative amongst fans at airport, gives warm hugStar India batter Virat Kohli spotted a close relative at the airport while travelling for the third ODI against England. The India star immediately walked over and gave a warm hug to the person.

Saurashtra batter Sheldon Jackson retires from professional cricket  Sheldon Jackson retired from professional cricket after Saurashtra lost to Gujarat in the Ranji Trophy in the quarterfinal. Jackson scored 7283 runs from 106 matches in first-class cricket since making his debut in 2011.

Don't care about 0-3 India series loss, want to win Champions Trophy: DuckettEngland opener Ben Duckett does not care about a 0-3 whitewash against India as long as England beats Rohit Sharma's side in the Champions Trophy Final. England are currently trailing India 0-2 in the 3-match series.

Former India bowler names Bumrah's perfect replacement for Champions TrophyWith questions surrounding Jasprit Bumrah's fitness, former India bowler Atul Wassan has named his ideal replacement for the ace speedster in the Champions Trophy 2025 squad.

Best seat in the house: Lanning on enjoying batting with Shafali in WPLWPL 2025: Delhi Capitals' skipper Meg Lanning said that she has enjoyed batting alongside Shafali Verma. Both Lanning and Shafali are expected to play key roles when DC start their campaign on February 15 against Mumbai Indians.

Special to be back with KKR, didn't want to play for another team: Vaibhav AroraVaiubhav Arora expressed his delight at being picked up by KKR during the IPL 2025 auction and claimed that he didn't want to play for another team. Vaibhav played a big role in KKR's title win in 2024.

IPL 2025: Ahmedabad-based conglomerate to buy majority stake in Gujarat TitansTorrent Group, an Ahmedabad-based conglomerate, will purchase a 67 per cent stake in Gujarat Titans. The deal is awaiting final approval from the IPL governing council.

Warrican beats Varun Chakravathy to win ICC Player of the Month for JanuaryWest Indies spinner Jomel Warrican has beaten Varun Chakravarthy to clinch the ICC Player of the Month Award for January. Warrican had a sensational Test series against Pakistan where he picked up 19 wickets from 2 Test matches.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
Jawaharlal Nehru University: Brains trustTeaching and research go hand in hand at the institute which is proud of its activist tradition.
